data.title: West Ham FC Soccer Day Camp and Overnight Camp London Location and Details
data.meta_description: West Ham United Foundation International Soccer Academy Location and Details near London, England
data.text:
Standard Field Player Sessions (beginners at soccer) – Coed Boys and Girls (first two weeks only) from 10 to 17 years old who are beginners at soccer:

The Standard program is designed for players who are beginners at soccer. By immersing players in a pro-club environment, it aims to help players develop and improve techniques in all areas including technical, physical, and psychological aspects of the game. In addition to the use of the latest video-analysis technology and training techniques, participants will have the opportunity to participate in the camp’s pro-experience seminars which are delivered by West Ham United Foundation’s staff and cover areas including scouting/player identification, nutrition and physical conditioning as well as other specialist areas.

Immerse yourself in a professional soccer environment with like-minded soccer enthusiasts and enhance your technical and match-play skills under the guidance of the West Ham United Foundation Coaching team. At the same time as participating in rewarding training sessions, it is an opportunity to showcase your skills through the game. Coaching sessions are aimed to develop the soccer skills of participants including agility, positioning, ball control, passing and moving, formations and tactics but also the ability to attack and defend.

Development Field Player Sessions (players do not have to belong to a soccer club) – Coed Boys and Girls (first two weeks only) from 10 to 17 years old:

The Development program is designed for players who are at a standard level and/or are aiming to go into the high performance level. By immersing players in a pro-club environment, it aims to help players develop and improve techniques in all areas including technical, physical, and psychological aspects of the game. In addition to the use of the latest video-analysis technology and training techniques, participants will have the opportunity to participate in the camp’s pro-experience seminars which are delivered by West Ham United Foundation’s staff and cover areas including scouting/player identification, nutrition and physical conditioning as well as other specialist areas.

Immerse yourself in a professional soccer environment with like-minded soccer enthusiasts and enhance your technical and match-play skills under the guidance of the West Ham United Foundation Coaching team. At the same time as participating in rewarding training sessions, it is an opportunity to showcase your skills through the game. Coaching sessions are aimed to develop the soccer skills of participants including agility, positioning, ball control, passing and moving, formations and tactics but also the ability to attack and defend.

High Performance Field Player Sessions (club level players only) – Coed Boys and Girls (first two weeks only) from 12 to 17 years old who belong to a Soccer Club:

The High Performance program is designed for players who belong to a Soccer Club and who are already playing soccer at a high level. The program aims to take participants to the next level through training methods and techniques developed for the professional teams. Training covers all areas of technical skills, tactical skills, physical conditioning and psychological techniques to provide a comprehensive and rewarding program. In addition to the use of the latest video analysis technology and training techniques, participants will have the opportunity to participate in the camp’s pro-experience seminars which are delivered by West Ham United Foundation’s staff and cover areas including scouting/player identification, nutrition and physical conditioning as well as other specialist areas.

Immerse yourself in a professional soccer environment with like-minded soccer enthusiasts and enhance your technical and match-play skills under the guidance of the West Ham United Foundation Coaching team. Players can pursue to reach their highest potential, focused on technical, tactical, team preparation and performance analysis, mental development and injury prevention. At the same time as participating in rewarding training sessions, it is an opportunity to showcase your skills and demonstrate your passion and commitment for soccer.

Goalkeeper Option – Coed Boys and Girls (first two weeks only) from 12 to 17 years old:

This camp also offers a Coed Goalkeeper training session option for Development and High Performance sessions for boys and girls from 12 – 17 years old whereby goalkeepers can receive specialized position training along with unique drills and goalkeeper coaching insight. Goalkeepers will have 5 hours per week of goalkeeper training in addition to 10 hours per week of soccer training.

GOALKEEPING:

Goalkeeping courses teach players those additional vital skills such a handling, footwork and distribution which can be overlooked when training as part of a team. goalkeeping courses are specialized, and the camp work in smaller groups to enhance development and therefore fitness levels should be of a high standard. Goalkeepers train independently to the football academy programme but come together during session enabling players to put techniques into practice.

ADVANCED GOALKEEPING:

Advanced goalkeeping courses work on the same basis as standard goalkeeping, but sessions are designed to meet the requirements of senior and advanced goalkeepers who require further technical detail incorporated into their training to aid progression and development. Advanced sessions are physically and technically challenging and we recommend that players be of a high standard of both fitness and ability. Goalkeepers who attend these sessions may have the opportunity to highly improve their skills. Advanced Goalkeeping courses available to boys and girls of an advanced level aged 12 – 17 years old.

ENGLISH COURSE PLUS GOALKEEPING

This programme is designed for boys and girls of all abilities aged 12 – 17 years old, to improve their goalkeeping skills. It consists of 10 hours of soccer training plus 5 hours goalkeeping training and 12 hours of English classes per week.

Day Camp Sessions:

There is a Day Camp Option which is available from Monday through Friday (daily lunch is included). (Option on Saturday to take a London excursion)

The Day Camp program will be the same as the program for residential participants from Monday through Friday.

Day Camp initial check-in will be on the Sunday before camp starts (check-in day only) at University College London and end of camp check-out will be on Friday after the soccer activities.

Day Camp participants will need to be dropped off every morning and picked up every afternoon at the Bobby Moore Sports Hub, Parsloes Park, Terrace Walk, Dagenham RM9 5PU

English as a Second Language Classes (Option Only), British Council accredited:

The Soccer and English Course incorporates 12 hours of English as a second language classes per week along with 15 hours per week of soccer training for both the Development sessions and the High Performance sessions.

Language tuition uses a fun, participative approach to learning and emphasizes spoken language skills. The program is specifically designed for children with an interest in soccer and includes a range of role-plays, pair-work, and activities. Created exclusively by Choices International and recognized by British Council with excellence for the teaching of English, the program develops English skills within a soccer context. Students receive 12 hours of English lessons per week which are taught by qualified teachers in classes of a maximum size of 15 students. Students are tested on arrival and placed in classes with other students of approximately the same level.

Excursions:

Campers staying one week are scheduled to go on a half-day excursion to London Stadium, the home of West Ham United F.C. Residential campers staying two consecutive weeks will also go on two more additional excursions consisting of a full-day tour to the London area and a full-day excursion to Kingston.
